required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Colostral Milk and Blood IL-6 Levels in Types of Labour
clinical_study.official_title: The Comparison of Serum and Colostral Melatonin, and IL-6 Levels Between Women With Vaginal Delivery, Emergency Cesarean Section and Elective Cesarean Section

brief_summary.textblock: The comparison of serum and colostral melatonin, and IL-6 levels between women with vaginal delivery, emergency cesarean section and elective cesarean section

detailed_description.textblock:
In this prospective randomized study, the investigators aimed to show the changes in the melatonin levels in colostral milk in spontaneous vaginal delivery,emergency cesarean and elective cesarean section patients and changes in blood IL-6 level before and after the delivery in same patient groups.
the investigators randomized 30 cases for each group for comparisons.Time range seems short in this study but participating hospital setting is a busy maternity hospital thus it will be performed easily.
The purpose of this study is to demonstrate the beneficial effect of spontaneous vaginal delivery on the secretion of melatonin which is solely secreted by the mother and the newborn is dependent on maternal milk oriented melatonin until 12 th week after delivery

primary_outcome.description: the measurement of serum IL-6 level in blood

primary_outcome.measure: Colostral Milk melatonin levels in different types of deliveries
primary_outcome.description: Colostral milk taken from the postpartum midnight breast milk were evaluated for melatonin levels

clinical_study.condition: Indications for Care in Pregnancy; Labor; and Delivery

arm_group.description: 30 women with spontaneous vaginal delivery will be included in group 1 serum IL-6 levels before and after delivery and colostral milk melatonin levels will be measured
30 women with emergency cesarean section will be included in group 2 serum IL-6 levels before and after delivery and colostral milk melatonin levels will be measured
30 women with elective cesarean section will be included in group 3serum IL-6 levels before and after delivery and colostral milk melatonin levels will be measured

intervention.intervention_name: The calculation of blood IL-6 and coloctral milk melatonin
intervention.description: Collected maternal colostral milk will be sampled for melatonin levels.Blood samples driven before and after delivery will be evaluated for IL-6 levels in each group

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria
- Pregnant women reached term
- Patients with spontaneous vaginal delivery
- Patients preferred cesarean section electively
- Patient who had emergency cesarean section without additional medical or surgical problems
Exclusion Criteria
- Women who had history of intrauterine fetal loss
- Hypertention during pregnancy
- Anemia
- Thyroid diseases
- Patients with chronic diseases
- Smokers
- Drug users
